title: Grateful Dead Live at Hartford Civic Center on 1981-03-14
lineage: MAC > Nakamichi DR-1 > Grace Design Lunatec V3 > S/pdif > WaveLAB 5.0 > WAV
description:
Set 1:
d1t01 - crowd/tuning
d1t02 - Feel Like A Stranger
d1t03 - Sugaree
d1t04 - Me And My Uncle >
d1t05 - Big River
d1t06 - Peggy-O >
d1t07 - CC Rider
d1t08 - Althea
d1t09 - Passenger
d1t10 - China Cat Sunflower >
d1t11 - I Know You Rider

Set 2:
d2t01 - crowd/tuning
d2t02 - Alabama Getaway >
d2t03 - Greatest Story Ever Told
d2t04 - Ship of Fools
d2t05 - Lost Sailor >
d2t06 - Saint Of Circumstance >
d2t07 - Drums >
d3t01 - Space >
d3t02 - The Other One >
d3t03 - Stella Blue >
d3t04 - I Need A Miracle >
d3t05 - Bertha >
d3t06 - Good Lovin'

Encore:
d3t07 - encore call
d3t08 - One More Saturday Night (1)

reviews.review_text:
Awesome recording Glassberg spring '81 + MOTB = Best source out there, period, bar none, end of story!!!

Great recording and transfer of an excellent show.  Thank you Barry and the MOTB team! :-D
Incredible sound! MotB is a great project! Five star sound! WOW! MotB rocks©!
Sugaree great recording!!!!!!Fabulous Sugaree!!!!

Top 10 AUD ob archive Maybe it's my system(Pioneer glass tube amp., Boston Acoustics Towers with intergrated sub woofers, and a Phat Paradigm stand alone sub woofer)but this sounds FREAKIN AWESOME!  I wish I could invite ya'll to my basement and then up to my livong romm to hang out and listen.  Oh shit, here comes my pissed off neighbor again...
MOTB MOTB = Mouth Of The Beast which is front and center between the stage and the mixing/sound board
Fastest Bertha Ever! slow down garcia
wang-dang-freakin-doodle This is the shit.
Super duper wicked nice. Right up there with the best of 'em.

Frosty's Picks for the Hearing Impaired I have major hearing problems. It’s called tinnitus and for those of you who don’t know it is a constant ringing in your ears. Therefore, it is hard for me to find audience shows that are of good enough quality for me to listen to without doing further damage to my hearing  by having to turn up the volume.  I am not saying anything about these shows except that as a person with major hearing lose, these are some of the shows that I have on my I-Pod.  I am not giving any of these shows a review. I can always find something good in every show…...as long as I can hear it!!!! Here is my list for today, 9/20/08:

7.6.84,         10.15.84,      6.19.91,    
7.18.89,        6.21.84,       9.6.85,   
10.12.84,      10.12.83,      11.1.85,
8.24.85,        7.31.82,       6.25.92,
8.5.89,         10.31.83,      6.26.92,
10.8.84,        12.5.81,       8.30.85,
11.5.85,        6.26.84,       8.3.82,
6.8.80,         4.3.84,        8.10.82,
3.14.81,        12.26.80,      4.15.83,
4.18.82,        10.31.91,      9.2.85,
10.14.83,       4.2.90,       4.30.90,
10.14.84,       

Please let me know if you have any show suggestions that compare to these in quality of sound.
Peace,
Frosty

Sweetest sweet spot ever? Absolutely one of the best sounding audience tapes I've ever heard. Can hardly believe how good this tape sounds for any era, let alone 1981. Complete and total mastery of the medium.
Glassberg + MOTB = KILLER Wonderful stuff from Glassberg and MOTB....Glassberg is the master of early 80's audience taping.

The Pied Piper of Hashbury Beautiful Peggy-O. Jerry burns at the end of the china>rider, with a great transition between the two. And my personal favorite, the other one>stella blue. I really love this show. To me, this is my favorite era and venue for the dead. Sounding very similar to mid 80's Spectrum shows.
This is an aud !?! This is hands down the best sounding aud i've ever heard, it sounds so clear it's almost impossible to believe that it's not a SBD

One Helluva' Show This was my second show,  this recording is fantastic.  All these years later I remember the crowd moving in unison to every note, and the oriental rug on the stage that was devilishly pulsing before my eyes as the music thundered!  This may be my favorite Sugaree, I can't wait to hear the rest of the recording.  For some reason, this show was not liked by all who saw it, this I'll never understand because this is a standout night.  Later.

Glassberg nailed it This sounds very very good. A few grades higher than most of the other releases of his.

The uptown feb shows sound fantastic as well.

Doh! I was on the wrong tab when I made my previous comment. This show is not in 24 bit, but is still a must have. Absolutely incredible. If anyone happens to know the dude screaming during Stella Blue, please punch him for me.
My first show Hello Barry and Adam. Mike B here. Thanks for this recording. This was my first GD show. Barry you nailed it! Are you going to any Furthur shows this summer?
wow from peggy-o to passenger, alabama & saint EPIC SET

One Hell of a Ride This show was high octane from start to finish. Jerry played with particularly intense speed throughout the entire show. Best audience recoding I have ever heard. Can someone please point me in the right direction to find other audience recordings of this quality. And good lord Bertha was hot. Cant wait to see Furthur at THE VIBES this upcoming week. Not the same magic at this though.

Excellent Recording! I was 21 and went w/out a ticket...looked for hours w/no luck...a door flew open and my friend and I were in..Not proud of my behavior but I was young.Many late 70's/early 80's aud. tapes were almost as clear as this one...later years qual. went way down in most cases...A great show but I still prefer 5-10-80, Hartford a little more...But you have to love how Jerry sounded on 3-14...A very well made recording!  Thanks!!!!!

Hartford CT This recording puts you in the crowd with soundboard quality music. Excellent show def worth the listen. I have to give this a 5, one of the best I have heard on the archive. Thank you for sharing!
Thank you archive This show is exactly what comes to mind when I think about the greatest band to walk to the earth.  I'm glad I'm a deadhead.
there's no concert like a dad concert Thanks a lot

Jerry Plays Bach? I'm not a classical music expert, but is Jerry playing Bach's,"Jesu, Joy of Man's Desiring" during the transition from The Other One > Stella Blue?  Even if you do not recognize the title, you will recognize the tune.  It's played at a lot of weddings.

- Well, repeated listening has mellowed my opinion a bit. While a good show with an excellent second set ender, it ain't quite as special as I thought. The ear gets picky after it's heard Irvine '87...

Picked cause it d/l so many times first time hearing this one. Freakin Sweet!!!!  New to the Dead. I use the reviews of the concert that you guys write to determine if I d/l or not. Thanks and keep it up.            Chris McConnell
ALTHEA! Best Althea ever period. Jerry at his nastiest!
Pleasant surprise A true gem that I just stumbled upon.Great party Dead from start to finish. Excellent sound quality as well; sounds great in the car!

Jesu: Joy of Man's Desiring Yes, indeed it is Jerry riffing on Bach....for a few bars, must have been quite a unique moment to be there for that!...Great Show, great recording, sound is impeccable. And Bertha....on speed for sure!, never heard it so fast!  This website is amazing.  I listen nearly every day!
Just like being there on the floor The best aud I have ever heard and a solid show.  Sounds just like I am on the floor in a killer seat.
Great Show Great Sound! Great Show!!

AUD of all AUDS This is hands down the greatest AUD of any show i've ever heard--and what a phenomenal show it is.

Typical blazing '81 picking by Jerry (BIG RIVER, CHINA>RIDER, ALTHEA), and great pack of songs post-drums highlighted by a powerful TOO>STELLA combo.

But the sound quality puts it over the top: all the clarity of a SBD and all the energy you expect from an AUD.

WOW x 2 Back in 2012 I wrote......  Now have to re
comment on this one. 
 As many have said below this is an amazing sounding Aud , everyone is correct. it is mind blowing how good this show sounds. Not the best of set lists yet is rip roaring . 
 I can picture the sweaty heads dancing all night long.  gets 5 stars twice in my book.
Reviewer: jjg4762 - ★favorite★favorite★favorite★favorite★favorite - September 27, 2012 
Subject: WOW 
wowie
Outstanding Good lord this is amazing - one of the best recordings and performances. Must listen and download. And yes the Bertha is fast.

Incredible AUD, awe-inspiring Althea This is one of those Dead performances that no matter what you are doing, even if you are just listening to this tape in the background, you stop, crank the volume, and just stare at the wall while Althea plays.

Super High Energy Yes well each track from this show logs over 180 plays on my Itunes.
Bertha!

another vote on the sound This is a top notch audience recording.

Lots of nice playing to boot.
Hartford Highlights: Bertha

Sugaree needs more love here Granted Althea is amazing, I mean cold beer after cutting the grass amazing.  Reaches you deep inside.  But Sugaree is fantastic, you could feel Jerry warming up in the first solo, and knew it would be a night to remember. The sweet wavering notes that begin the second solo ease you into the Big Man's exploration that doesn't quite satiate what he needs, but then he dives back in for a second helping and gets closer.  Its a real crowd pleaser.  

After Bobby gives him a break he comes back later in the set with that amazing Althea.  

After space he finds enough in the tank to give us a classic Stella.   Vocally one of my favorites, and instrumentally as crisp as they come.  The last solo is mystical.  The way he dances up to the crescendo then backs off over and over leaves you love sick.  

Many thanks tor such an awesome recording too.  This mastery makes this show as much as the boys did.

Great show and recording Reiterating most of the other reviews here, a great all around show. The Sugaree is just fantastic. Makes me smile. This show for me is what the Dead were capable of in the 80s. They went and incorporated components of the older style of jams with a focus on instrumentation and then started bringing in a new rock and roll style of playing their shows.  The Dead changed to a degree with the times specifically in the 70s and then the 80s.  It sure was excellent on nights that they played great.

1st show Drove down with my friend Mark from Franklin Pierce College in New Hampshire. He had exposed me to the band during my freshman year. 
I knew of them, but until that point, had only listened to Skeletons from the Closet album. 
We were in the upper level as far from the stage as you could be. 
Although I recall this show, my second show in Providence on 5/16/81 made a permanent impression on me. Mark took me to that one too. 
I blame the next 14 years of touring on him.
Jeeeez.... Stellar. Simply Stellar Show.
Jesu, The joy of mans desire Jesu was played between other one and stella blue.
Just A Great Listening Experience Come for the Althea, stay for the Sugaree. Oh my, Jerry. A smokin’ show.

Just keep coming back to this one! I love all the songs on this set but of course I have to point out a few outstanding Jerry songs. 

Peggy-O

Ship of Fools 

These two are some of the top, extended picking solos for these songs, in my opinion of course. 

Definitely a good Stranger and Passenger. 

Get that "rare" China Cat-> Rider in the early 80s. 

Tone from all the stringed instruments is on point. 

Give it a listen!

Short List of Favorites Like Sherpa said below, I just keep coming back to this show. Every Jerry song is fantastic, but Althea and the last few minutes of Stella are  next level good. Really into early Brent era lately - specifically 81 & 82. Can’t really think of any bad things to say about this one. 5 stars.
still the best AUD of this show very balanced aud of a good++ show

superior show, nice aud agree w/ some of the other comments about '81-'82: a golden era of brent-era grateful dead -- and this show reflects that. the '81 east coast spring tour to follow the brief europe run among the best tours of the early 80's imo... the sugaree, peggy-o and althea are all killer and the rippin' alabama set 2 opener sets the tone for the rest... thx to the band and barry g. for this excellent pull

Grate balls of batshit!!! This is a peak audience recording. I present to you exhibit A, Stella Blue. Jerry's vocal tone and guitar texture on this recording is sublime. This one goes in the permanent collection.

Thank you Barry Glassberg. Thank you Mr. Garcia and associates.
Sailor>Saint OMG, the audience recording is of special quality and you if you like Sailor>Saint you are going to LOVE this.

Such a great recording of a well played show Had to give this one 5 stars because I was there as a fifteen year old head. Second show for me and a magic night. Really a great Stranger jam this night too. I didn’t see many reviews mention that. Lots of great playing here. Band was so tight during this whole show.
